definition: abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: The result is a very earthy, informal language.
sentences.chinese: 結果是一個非常樸實的，非正式的語言。

sentences.english: The Chinese presidents have attended all the APEC informal leaders’ meetings.
sentences.chinese: 中國國家主席出席了歷次APEC領導人非正式會議。

sentences.english: And now it has been expanded as a non-official profession with huge potential market.
sentences.chinese: 現在已經成爲具有巨大市場潛力的非正式職業了。

sentences.english: In any case, by the autumn of 2006 the line between unofficial concept and formal project had been crossed.
sentences.chinese: 2006年秋天，這個非正式項目轉正了。

sentences.english: So the moon has been informally christened.
sentences.chinese: 所以月亮已經被非正式的被洗禮了。

sentences.english: It’s a casual party, you know.
sentences.chinese: 你知道這是個非正式的聚會。

sentences.english: Shopping is still an informal affair in Luang Prabang.
sentences.chinese: 購物那些錯過，仍然是琅勃拉邦非正式的事。

sentences.english: The Chairman said he would continue with his informal consultations on this issue.
sentences.chinese: 主席稱自己會繼續就這個問題開展非正式的磋商。

sentences.english: All the dangers of informality come with it.
sentences.chinese: “所有非正式信息都伴隨着危險”。

sentences.english: This informal idiom for proposing marriage has been in use since 1826.
sentences.chinese: 這個表示求婚的非正式習語從1826年就開始使用。

sentences.english: The ability to show a sense of humor at off-the-cuff and casual conversations is also incredibly important.
sentences.chinese: 在即席和非正式談話中顯示幽默感也非常重要。

sentences.english: It’s a very informal and very free-flowing dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 那是非正式和非常自由的對話。

sentences.english: He flied non-stop from Beijing to Nanjing to attend an informal dinner party.
sentences.chinese: 他從北京直飛南京就是爲了參加一個非正式的晚宴。

sentences.english: And, we’ll show you how to finish up your argument, either formally or informally.
sentences.chinese: 也會教你如何結束陳述，無論是正式地還是非正式地。

sentences.english: Mister Ban was the winner this week in unofficial voting by the Security Councial.
sentences.chinese: 潘先生是此次安理會非正式投票的贏家。

sentences.english: Her speech is informal and filled with colloquialism.
sentences.chinese: 她的演講是非正式的，很口語化。

definition: private/personal/interpersonal/sb with whom one has a close personal relationship/a member of one's clique
consultative conference (political venue during early communist rule)/consultative meeting/deliberative assembly
established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
